This is TALK OF THE NATION.
I'm Jennifer Ludden in Washington.
Wednesday, the Supreme Court will hear arguments on the Voting Rights Act.
At issue: whether to uphold Section Five, which requires nine states and parts of seven others, to get federal approval to change their voting laws.
Congress just reauthorized the mandate in 2006.

At heart, the case raises the issue of fairness, the states effected have a history of making it difficult for black citizens and other minorities to vote, and the Voting Rights Act in 1965 was meant to protect their rights.
